Posts.Content: Hi Geordiegirl47, I'm assuming you're from Newcastle or that area, I found Debenhams at Metro Centre the best place to purchase post surgery bras, they have a bra fitting service which you need an appointment for, when I went I had to wait an hour to get one. They have fab bras for us post surgery ladies. Hope this helps, regards Alison x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy bras for big boob

Posts.Content: Hi does anyone know the timescale for breast reconstruction when treatment ends? I had a mastectomy in July this year, due to finish chemotherapy in December, no radiotherapy needed just a year of herceptin. My bcn is hopeless, I'm asking questions and she just keeps saying she'll get back to me and she doesn't!  Thanks in advance.
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after treatment

Posts.Content: Thank you Kacang for your reply, I'm just impatient and want to get back to feeling feminine again! If it is the case of waiting till after herceptin then I'll have to be more patient lol. Take care, regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi StormyLovesOdd, Thank you for your reply to my post, you've described how I feel to a T! My partner has and is very patient with me although at times I do feel sorry for him! I too feel lop sided being a large busted lady, although I think even if I was a smaller bust I'd still feel how I do, my scar is horrid and I cry whenever I look at it or catch sight of it in the shower, I know reconstruction isn't going to be perfect but at least it will be made from me and not some foreign implant! Good luck with your reconstruction when you have it. Best wishes, Alison
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi G n' J, Thanks for your reply, I'm lucky in one way that I don't need radiotherapy, which has me thinking that the waiting time should be shorter? I'd be happy with a reduction too if that's what the surgeon would advise, anything to get back to feeling like a woman again! Regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi my hair has grown back in small tight curls, spoke to a hairdresser yesterday and she suggested I use a perm solution to lessen the curls, basically apply as if I'm having a perm but use no curlers just a comb and comb it through for 20 mins, rinse and apply neutraliser comb that through for the time in instructions then rinse and condition, this should create wavy hair. I'm wondering if anyone else has tried this?  I loved my hair when it was just growing back it had a lovely soft wave to it however these curls are like an 80's perm lol!
Posts.Title: Curly Hair!

Posts.Content: Thank you MM,  That's another thing I'd not considered having to possibly wait till after the herceptin ends?  I've requested that I be put on the waiting list already, so I'm in the system when the time comes. I don't know which reconstruction, I do know it was mentioned about taking flesh/muscle from my tummy to do it. I'm in a mess emotionally and feel that once I have reconstruction I can move forward with my life & feel feminine again!  Good luck with your recuperation. Regards & thanks, Alison
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn, I wish I had your outlook on bc & mastectomy and the scars that I'm left with!  I wish you good health in the future. Regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi Tracey, Thank you for sharing your reconstruction experience with me, I do realise that I'll be in pain and bruised afterwards however I think that's worthwhile if the end effect gives me back the feminity and confidence I had before this nightmare began.  Best wishes, Alison
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, thanks for taking time to respond to my post. I think going from all your comments I'll ignore the advice given by hairdresser! Maybe keep it shorter that it is to keep the curls at bay. Regards & Happy Easter to you all, Alison x
Posts.Title: Curly Hair!

Posts.Content: Hi Gill, Thank you for your reply to my post. I'm seeing my oncologist next week so I'll ask her and then chase it up with my bcn! Good luck with your surgery & recuperation. Regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Reconstruction after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi Karen Thanks for your response to my post. I'm happy with my colour which is a lovely grey which is totally different to my pre cancer diagnosis as I used to be plum!  I was told by oncologist to wait 6 months before colouring hair I mentioned this to hairdresser and she agreed with that, I then asked how it was possible to use a perm solution under six months from finishing chemotherapy, she said it would be OK as perm solution doesn't effect hair the same as a colour! I am a tad confused about it & this is why I posted on here. Finished chemotherapy in November 16 now having Herceptin and I'm a third of the way through that treatment. Regards, Alison x
Posts.Title: Curly Hair!

Posts.Content: Hi Kiwicardi  Thank you for your response, today I've managed more fluids by drinking fruit teas and I've had more tap water than carbonated, I've also bought some fruit ice lollies. I've introduced one Senna per day as I found I got constipated, I spoke to my chemo nurse and she said that was ok and if needed to increase to two per day, at present I'm getting by on one, this may help you?  I've had a walk out today but had to come back after 15 minutes I was zapped of energy and so tired, still feeling a little nausea however not as bad as yesterday.  Take care, Alison
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Hi Karen, Thank you for your reply, one of the things I am doing regularly is taking my temperature and so far so good. I've bought various ice lollies and have today managed to drink some lemon squash with plain tap water however still a bit nausea kicking in!  I went out today to our local shops about 10 mins there and back and oh my that zapped my energy, went to bed and slept for 3hrs!  Good to hear you're finished your treatment and have enjoyed a well deserved holiday. Take care, kind regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Hi I had my second chemotherapy yesterday, I'm struggling to drink fluids today, feel very nauseous, anti-sickness meds don't seem to be helping!  Have any of you got any suggestions?  Thank you in advance, Alison
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Thank you Wendy, I am trying different soft drinks. I too have Emend plus others. My first chemo the nausea didn't start till day four and I managed that well, but today has floored me. if I'm like this tomorrow I'll call the ward. regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Hi PictureMish, Thanks for your response, I was ok after my first cycle it was day four when the sickness hit however this time it was the next day! I've purchased a pill box and have my meds all set out for across the day/week, have also set alarm on my phone to remind me to take them.  My sister-in-law brought me some Schlor last week and that was elderflower I enjoyed that for  a change, my tastebuds are aweful at the moment too nothing tastes as it should!  Well done on finishing your chemotherapy hope you have a healthy future ahead. Regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Hi Baki thank you for your reply. i drink carbonated water with assorted squash, not tried fruit teas but will, not a lover of almond milk however I do have a glass of milk each evening before bed. regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Hi G n' J thank you for your reply, I already have ginger biscuits however I will get some arrowroot ones, I know I used to buy these for my sister-in-law when she suffered morning sickness!  Regards,  alison
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Hi Flopsyuk, Thank you for your response. I've always liked milk but I'm finding I'm drinking more now, a glass with some ginger biscuits at night when I can't sleep, however I'm finding semi-skimmed a tad too creamy think I'll go back onto skimmed and see if that's better?  My brother has a problem with his taste buds as well due to head injury and he's recommended I try melon & pineapple to get some fluids plus to help with the aweful taste in my mouth!  Hope all works well for you, take care, regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Hi Daisy31 thank you for your response, I have tried ginger nuts but to no avail :( Regards Alison
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Hi Julia, Thank you for your reply, I like the sound of ice lollies will get some tomorrow. I do have squash with sparkling water, tap water and orange juice. Yesterday's treatment was a tough one felt sick whilst having it, took four attempts to find a vein, I did tell the nurse but she put it down to the vein site being on my forearm. Regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Thanks Carolyn, all being well I'll be going to Tesco tomorrow :) regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa, Ice cold ginger ale sounds good and a nice change I'll add that to my list for next shopping trip, I've got ginger biscuits and some stem ginger oat cakes to try, not purchased any arrowroot biscuits yet!  Take care, Alison
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Hi Fiddlesticks, I've recently had a mastectomy and my first shop I went to for bras was M&S in my home town of Darlington, they were great with a good selection of post surgery bras for the larger lady, yes they had your old fashioned ones however I got lovely fashionable ones, a fushia pink then a pack of two one black with spots and the other a pale peach/pink. I'm sure if you take a look around whether it be on the high street or online you'll find what you're looking for.
Posts.Title: Bras - rant!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Kerry, I had a mastectomy yr gone July, followed by chemotherapy & now herceptin. I've chosen not to take tamoxifen as I want to get away from treatment, also the oncologist gave me my "predict" figures based on my breast cancer and I was only going to benefit by 3% if taking tamoxifen! Have you been given your predict figures as this may help with what you decide? With regards to my body I'm struggling and I won't let my partner see me naked, I'm so pleased that he understands, I'll be having reconstruction done next yr so looking forward to closing this chapter in my life. Regards, Alison x
Posts.Title: Side effects of tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I started chemotherapy on 2/9 next one due this week, has anyone else suffered with a tender/sore to touch scalp, could this be a sign that my hair loss is about to start?  I've tried paracetamol but not helped!  Thank you, Alison
Posts.Title: Sore/Tender Scalp

Posts.Content: Hi G n'J Thank you for your response to my post, I had my hair cut short a few weeks ago in preparation of the chemotherapy it's about an inch in length. I'm having my wig fitting this week which seems to be timed right!  Regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Sore/Tender Scalp

Posts.Content: Thanks Tracey for your reply, I might consider having it clipped, will see when I go for my wig fitting as they are hairdressers too!  I'm having EC chemotherapy followed by herceptin injections for a year. Good luck with your treatment. Regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Sore/Tender Scalp

Posts.Content: Hi Kiwicardi thanks for this I saw this on the September chemo group. Are you trying the cold cap? They advised me not to try it due to me suffering migraines!  My hair is shedding quite a bit today, just running my fingers through and I get a good handful of hair! I've got a wig fitting tomorrow so I might take the clippers to it however I'll see if they will do it as they're a hairdressers too? Good luck with your 2nd cycle. Regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Sore/Tender Scalp

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa, I'm 18 months post surgery and still have odd sensations where my breast was. I was similar to you & many others who have had a diagnosis for cancer, feeling numb and not taking in what has happened, it all happens so fast that it'll take awhile for your head to catch up with what is going on. I'm sure others will comment on your post, this group are great at offering support to each other. Take it easy & let your husband do a lot of the chores!! Sending warm wishes for Christmas & 2018 Alison x
Posts.Title: Day 4 post surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Vonnie1 my nails were in a desperate state of splitting too with just a little growth, I've found IBX nail treatment has helped greatly, it's a heat treatment carried out in a nail salon, I googled to see where my nearest one was. I've had 4 treatments and can see the difference,  it costs me £10 per treatment, I also use almond oil a couple of times per day, massaging into critical and nail bed. Hope this helps, Regards Alison
Posts.Title: Hair and Nails and galloping Osteoarthritis

Posts.Content: Hi I used Grow Me shampoo & conditioner about 6 weeks post chemotherapy and found it helped, my hair grew quickly, I had thick head prior to hair loss and it grew back thick too, I used this until I finished the bottles I now use John Frida. Regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Hair and Nails and galloping Osteoarthritis

Posts.Content: Hi June, I've got very fair eyebrows and prior to surgery & chemotherapy I used to have them tinted regularly. I'm not good with make up & how to apply it which is one of the reasons to have my eyebrows & lashes tinted again! Regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Eyebrow Tinting!

Posts.Content: Thanks Ronstar for your reply, think I'll wait the six months!  Regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Eyebrow Tinting!

Posts.Content: Hi all I know after chemotherapy it's recommended that you don't colour your hair for six months, I'm wanting to know is it the same for having eyebrows & eye lashes tinted?
Posts.Title: Eyebrow Tinting!

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn thanks for your response, good to know it worked for you Regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Eyebrow Tinting!

Posts.Content: Hi Bjez my oncologist was the same as yours totally dismissed my dizzy spells & painful joints/bones. She asked me a couple of questions about the dizziness and replied "you don't have brain cancer" which I found really odd! She said the painful bones/joints were a remaining side effect to chemotherapy which surprised me as I didn't have that side effect during chemotherapy! Regards Alison x
Posts.Title: Herceptin side effects help

Posts.Content: Hi Dl99 I've had six Herceptin and I also suffer with painful joints & bones along with what I would describe as lead legs for 7-10 days after treatment! My oncologist suggested taking anti-inflammatories the day before treatment & to continue for 3-4 days, this didn't help me however it may help you, I also read somewhere on this site someone recommended a magnetic bracelet, as it helped with there aches, I bought a lovely one from Amazon which also looks good, I've worn it for three weeks now with no improvement, I think we'll try anything within reason to help with side effects! regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Aches n pains

Posts.Content: Hi I had my 7th round of Herceptin yesterday, I've changed from injection to intravenous due to painful administering, yesterday the nurse struggled to get a canular in and commented that it was my skin, saying it was hard/tough, hence it was painful! I'm wondering if anyone else has come across this whilst have treatment?  I don't understand as I moisturise my hands 2/3 times a day. Thank you for reading, regards, Alison
Posts.Title: Hard/tough skin Herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn thanks for replying to my post, I found the injection very painful prior to Friday I've had two introvenously without any problems, I'm hoping Friday's is a one off!  Onwards and upwards.  Regards, Alison x
Posts.Title: Hard/tough skin Herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi Baileybelle, I'd recommend Debenhams, they have gorgeous feminine bras which are reasonably priced. Regards Alison
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Bras!
